alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 7:05PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Monroe County through 800 PM EDT... At 704 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Britton to near Adrian. Movement was east at 75 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Milan and Dundee around 710 PM EDT. Petersburg, Maybee and Ottawa Lake around 715 PM EDT. Temperance and Ida around 720 PM EDT. Carleton and Luna Pier around 725 PM EDT. Monroe and Flat Rock around 730 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Newport, Cone, Estral Beach, Toledo Beach, Erie, South Rockwood, Woodland Beach, Stony Point, Bolles Harbor and Samaria. People attending Monroe County Fair should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Michigan.
